media:group.media:title: What is the difference between == and is in Python?
media:group.media:description: The == operator compares the values of two objects, checking if they are equal. The is operator compares the identity of two objects, checking if they are the same object in memory. Use == for value comparison, use is for identity comparison, like checking if a variable is None.

media:group.media:description: A list is mutable, meaning you can add, remove, or modify elements after creation. A tuple is immutable, meaning once created, you cannot change its elements. Lists use square brackets, tuples use parentheses. Use lists when you need to modify the collection, use tuples for fixed data like coordinates or database records.
